item.title: Creating and combining multiple animations with gganimate and magick
item.description: Credit Thanks to Robert Walker for showing how to combine multiple animations using the magick package in R. Wow, you can side-by-side gganimates with imagemagick. That was fun to put together. #rstats #tidyTuesday An adaptation of measles and a map… pic.twitter.com/FPOgAOQS84 — Robert Walker (@PieRatio) December 16, 2019 Animating cars In a previous blogpost, I showed how to create a new geom to plot cars as seen from top and rear.

item.title: Draw cars with ggplot2
item.description: Credit: I wanted to draw cars Creating geom_car Load Libraries Load data Coordinates plot Step 1: Create a car image with no fill color Step 2: Create a graphical object (grob) from the image Step 3: Map the data to the grob using ggproto Step 4: Create the external interface i.e. the geom_car layer Plotting the cars Attempt 1 to plot cars Attemp 2: Adjust the coordinates and plot again Attempt 3 - Fixing y coordinate Car Rear View Bonus: Animation Credit: Thanks to BrodieG for answering my stackoverflow question about drawing diagrams in R.

item.title: About R gems
item.description: This blog is about all the R gems that I’ve found and bookmarked on Twitter over the years. I also record my mitakes and errors in R coding and write about how I eventually found a solution. You might find something interesting and useful here.
